claims.object: Antibody binding to epitopes on other antigens

surface_layer.definition: The ability of an antibody to bind to multiple different antigens.

deep_layer.mechanism: Cross-reactivity arises when an antibody binds to an epitope that is similar but not identical to its target epitope.
deep_layer.origin: Can be caused by low avidity or specificity of the antibody, or by multiple distinct antigens having identical or very similar epitopes.

citations: An Introduction to Antibodies : Antibody - Antigen Interaction
